meanings.definition: A small, slow-moving caterpillar that moves by contracting and expanding its body in a looping motion.
meanings.sent1: The inchworm crawled along the leaf carefully.
meanings.sent2: I saw an inchworm on the branch outside.
meanings.sent3: The inchworm tried to measure the leaf but got lost in the process.
meanings.sent4: Her progress in the project was as slow as an inchworm's crawl.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the inchworm's unique way of moving.

meanings.definition: To move or progress slowly and steadily, resembling the movement of an inchworm.
meanings.sent1: He would inchworm his way through the obstacle course.
meanings.sent2: The snail inchwormed its way across the garden path.
meanings.sent3: She decided to inchworm her way through the crowded room to avoid bumping into people.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to inchworm forward as he waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The old car inchwormed along the road, barely making any progress.
